item.title: Weapons to Unlock Before Into The Unjust in Helldivers 2
item.description:
After the Illuminate made it onto the surface of Super Earth, players in Helldivers 2 have been itching to really get back at the enemies of democracy in any way they can. While the usual fronts always offer a chance to wipe out the enemies of Super Earth, players will soon be able to take the fight straight to the Termanid Hive Worlds.

Into the Unjust is an upcoming content update that will have players running along the surface and in the tunnels of Termanid Hive Worlds, bringing all sorts of hordes of bugs and new massive enemies to fight. In preparation for this new content, here are some weapons and strategems you'll want to unlock.

Best Weapons to Get for Into the Unjust in Helldivers 2

Termanid's biggest weakness is fire, so you'll want to consider getting the Freedom's Flame Warbond, as it offers a few decent incendiary weapons that are worth bringing on any mission to a Hive World.

  • P-72 Crisper
  • FLAM-66 Torcher
  • SG-451 Cookout


The Cookout at least offers light armor penetration, though there are a few other decent options if you don't want to get that Warbond, with some of the still effective options just not being incendiary.

  • AR-23P Liberator Penetrator
  • SMG-32 Reprimand
  • SG-225IE Breaker Incendiary
  • GP-31 Grenade Pistol

Always bring High Explosive Grenades.

Best Strategems for Into the Unjust in Helldivers 2

The following strategems are a list of some that are good against swarms of bugs and some that are great for dealing with massive threats like Bile Titans. Even in the higher difficulties, you'll want a healthy mix of both to stay alive. In the lower difficulties, just focus on crowd control options. The Exosuit will be left off as it is an auto-take if you have it, and the remaining options should fill your remaining slots.

Supply Strategems

  • MG-43 Machine Gun
  • FLAM-40 Flamethrower
  • RL-77 Airburst Rocket Launcher
  • RS-422 Railgun
  • GL-21 Grenade Launcher
  • LAS-99 Quasar Cannon
  • Any guard dog

Defensive Strategems

  • A/ARC-3 Tesla Tower
  • Flame Sentry
  • MD-14 Incendiary Mines


Offensive Strategems

  • Eagle 500Kg Bomb
  • Eagle Napalm Airstrike
  • Orbital Napalm Barrage
  • Orbital Laser

Fire will be your best option, though it's important to know that you can accidentally catch on fire if you step into it . Use fire to cut off the enemy and kill whatever tries to reach you, playing mostly a defensive game while using the fire as your main asset. If you're playing in a squad, you'll want to hit as many of the above weapons and strategems as possible, as higher difficulties will only increase all types of enemies, not just the strongest and heavily armored ones.

item.title: Best Open-World PS3 Games, Ranked
item.description:
The PlayStation 3 era marked a major evolution in open-world design. With improved hardware came larger maps, more dynamic systems, and deeper player freedom, and the best open-world games allow players to engage with the environment on their terms through the in-game mechanics and the access they have to the environment.

There have been plenty of impactful open-world titles that redefined the genre or just delivered an unforgettable experience that still holds up several generations later. Whether traversing chaotic cityscapes or untamed wilderness, these games defined the genre during a formative console generation and still stand as essential benchmarks for world-building.

8 Infamous 2

Becoming The Perfect Anti-Hero

inFAMOUS 2
8 /10
8.7 /10
Released
June 7, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Sucker Punch
Platform(s)
PlayStation 3
Powered by

Set in the fictional city of New Marais, Infamous 2 delivers a deeply reactive open world shaped by player morality. As Cole MacGrath, choices determine the fate of the city, altering public perception, ally behavior, and story outcomes, and the karmic system gives narrative weight to traversal and combat decisions.

The city itself is filled with distinct districts and destructible environments full of side missions and collectibles for players to uncover. And enemy encounters are intelligently placed to encourage player engagement across the map, exemplifying how open-world design can support both storytelling and moment-to-moment freedom in a superhero context.

7 Sleeping Dogs

A City That Lives And Breathes With The Story

Sleeping Dogs
9 /10
10
8.3 /10
Released
August 14, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
United Front Games
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

Sleeping Dogs brings players into a stylized open-world version of Hong Kong, offering a rare urban setting rich with cultural detail. The games world stands out for its vibrant neighborhoods, seamless integration of the narrative, and atmospheric density that supports both grounded storytelling and arcade-like exploration.

The map remains active with events and encounters that push players toward all corners of the city, even outside of the actual story. Whether chasing down triads or diving into street races, every district feels lived-in and distinct, allowing it to become one of the most memorable and immersive open-world titles on the PS3.

6 Just Cause 2

Chaos And Action From Start To Finish

Just Cause 2
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
March 23, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Avalanche Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

Few open-world games embrace scale and spectacle like Just Cause 2 . Set on the fictional island nation of Panau, the game offers one of the largest maps on the PS3, filled with military bases, cities, forests, and snowy mountain ranges, with plenty of destruction built directly into the design.

Causing chaos disrupts enemy control, unlocks missions, and draws attention from opposing forces, meaning that even when free roaming the map, players can still find new objectives to aim for. Combined with a grappling hook and parachute system, the open world becomes a physics-driven sandbox of improvisation that rewards creativity and exploration in equal measure.

5 Assassins Creed IV: Black Flag

Stealth Meets Seafaring Adventures

Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag
10.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Black Flag pushed the Assassins Creed formula into a true open-world direction. Set in the Caribbean during the golden age of piracy, the game connects dozens of islands and ports with seamless naval exploration, with every outpost, wreck, or jungle hideout offering tangible narrative or mechanical rewards.

What elevates the experience is the ability to forge ones path. Sailing to undiscovered locations, engaging in sea battles, or simply diving for treasure creates a uniquely player-driven experience, and the game Black excels not just in size but in the sheer number of ways its world invites experimentation and exploration.

4 Far Cry 3

Aquatic Mysteries And Ariel Views

Far Cry 3
9 /10
14
9.0 /10
Released
November 29, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

Far Cry 3 transforms its tropical setting into a volatile, living sandbox. The Rook Islands are filled with unpredictable wildlife and tribal factions that reshape the terrain, and the player's progress changes the balance of power, leaving visible impacts on the world.

This feedback loop between action and world state makes every decision carry weight. Outposts captured become friendly zones, and player upgrades tie directly into exploration. Narrative choices and environmental storytelling create a setting that constantly reacts to engagement, ensuring that curiosity always yields consequence or discovery.

3 Red Dead Redemption

Pushing The Boundaries Of A Video Game Narrative

5 Images
5 Images
Red Dead Redemption
8 /10
20
9.5 /10
Released
May 18, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Rockstar San Diego
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Red Dead Redemption redefines the Western by grounding it in a deeply reactive open world. From wildlife behavior to weather patterns, the American frontier of 1911 feels alive and unpredictable, full of characters and emergent events, injecting constant motion into the environment.

Every region, whether desert, forest, plains, or swamps, has its own identity, with quests and encounters reflecting the settings character. Player actions influence honor, which shapes NPC behavior and mission outcomes, and Rockstar's attention to ambient storytelling and environmental detail makes Red Dead Redemption a landmark open-world that remains near the top of many people's lists.

2 Grand Theft Auto IV

The Perfect City Sandbox

Grand Theft Auto 4
25
9.1 /10
Released
April 29, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox 360, PS3
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Liberty City in GTA IV is dense, moody, and intricately constructed, giving players literally 1000s of hours of content to enjoy over and over again. Unlike the later GTA V, this world trades expansiveness for realism and atmosphere, as streets feel lived in, citizens behave believably, and missions unfold with narrative gravity across the citys boroughs.

The game rewards exploration not with collectibles but with immersion. Interactions at safehouses, radio commentary, and random street events lend the world authenticity, and the character and city complexity result in an open world that serves both as a playground and a social commentary.

1 The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

Defining A Generation Of RPGs

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
80
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Skyrim stands as the definitive open-world experience for players who want an RPG that covers every basis with perfection. The game offers a fully explorable fantasy realm where virtually every action shapes the world. From the frozen peaks of High Hrothgar to the political intrigue of Solitude, every town, cave, and ruin carries lore, conflict, and excitement.

Its strength lies in the freedom afforded. Players can ignore the main quest entirely and still alter the world through faction alliances or other encounters in their travels, and side quests often rival mainline content in complexity. Few games match Skyrim's breadth of narrative and player agency, and despite being over a decade old, it remains a titan of the genre.

item.title: How to Get All Helldivers 2 Halo/ODST Weapons & Armor
item.description:
Helldivers 2 has had one clear collaboration that needed to happen that many fans noticed right when the game released. Helldivers strike a huge resemblance to ODST in the Halo series, and after asking for so long, this much-anticipated collaboration is finally here.

This collaboration comes in the Obedient Democracy Support Troopers legendary Warbond, which is now available in-game to purchase and start unlocking things in. Here's how much everything costs, along with everything that's inside the Warbond.

All Halo/ODST Collaboration Items & How Much They Cost in Helldivers 2

In total, there are four new weapons to use, with everything else being armor and skins to equip on your various vehicles or character cards. The Obedient Democracy Support Troopers Warbond costs 1,500 Super Credits to unlock, with everything else being unlocked with the following medal amounts.

Page 1

Item

Cost

MA5C Assault Rifle

35 Medals

Mean Green Hellpod Pattern

20 Medals

Honored Heirloom (Cape)

8 Medals

A-9 Helljumper (Body Armor)

45 Medals

A-9 Helljumpe r (Helmet)

30 Medals

Honored Heirloom (Player Card)

2 Medals

Page 2

Item

Cost

A-35 Recon (Helmet)

45 Medals

Eye of the Clandestine (Cape)

25 Medals

A-35 Recon (Body Armor)

55 Medals

Eye of the Clandestine (Player Card)

7 Medals

Mean Green Shuttle Pattern

50 Medals

M7S SMG

50 Medals

Page 3

Item

Cost

Mean Green Exosuit Pattern

50 Medals

M6C/SOCOM Pistol

75 Medals

Rookie (Title)

20 Medals

M90A Shotgun

65 Medals

Mean Green FRV Pattern

55 Medals

Is the Obedient Democracy Support Troopers Warbond Worth It in Helldivers 2?

Unlike some of the other Warbonds you can get in Helldivers 2 , the ODST Warbond can be a bit of a mixed bag with its price. A lot of the things unlocked are cosmetics with no real benefits, though the weapons throughout the Warbond are some of the best in every class. The Assault Rifle and Shotgun are some of the best weapons in the game , and are only obtainable through this Warbond. If you play this game even just a bit, this Warbond is worth it for the weapons alone, with the armor only adding icing to the cake and giving you the basis for a stealth build for those who don't like going in guns blazing.

You'll need 400 Medals to unlock just the weapons and armor, not counting the requirements to get to later pages. Overall, the Warbond requires 637 Medals to unlock everything , if those green patterns look cool to you and are worth purchasing to equip.

item.title: Stardew Valley Dev Shares New Look at Haunted Chocolatier
item.description:
The developer of Stardew Valley and the upcoming Haunted Chocolatier has shared a new image from the latter, giving fans a new glimpse into the art style and atmosphere of the game. Developer ConcernedApe has also shared a detail regarding a popular - but controversial - Stardew Valley mini-game that will return in Haunted Chocolatier .

Haunted Chocolatier was announced back in 2021, but so far, the creator has only said that he hopes to release Haunted Chocolatier no later than 2030. The developer has been working on the game, but has also regularly returned to release new updates for Stardew Valley , adding content and fixing bugs. That's led to less time being spent on Haunted Chocolatier , but over the years, ConcernedApe has been gradually teasing more information about the upcoming game, and has now done so again.

ConcernedApe Shares New Haunted Chocolatier Screenshot

Over on Twitter, the developer of Haunted Chocolatier uploaded a new screenshot from the game, showing just how much his artistic style has evolved since Stardew Valley . While there are visual similarities between the two, Haunted Chocolatier 's art appears to be more detailed, with more texture on objects like the ground and trees, and the style of the character sprites has changed since the developer's first game. The screenshot shows a character looking at a flowing river sandwiched between two woodsy areas, which include a massive treehouse, complete with windows, an archway, and mushrooms climbing the sides.

While the screenshot is exciting in its own right, ConcernedApe also responded to a fan who wondered if fishing would make a return in the game. The developer simply stated that there will be fishing in the game, but didn't say anything further. This has left fans to speculate, as while some players greatly enjoy the fishing system in Stardew Valley , others despise it, especially in the early days when it can be quite difficult. ConcernedApe added a training rod to the game to make fishing easier in Stardew Valley in the early stages, and has likely taken the criticism into consideration when building Haunted Chocolatier .

For now, fans will just have to keep waiting for updates on Haunted Chocolatier as the years roll on. Each small snippet released by the developer keeps the fans interested, and in the meantime, Stardew Valley still has a thriving community and modding scene that keeps players actively playing it.

item.title: Yoshi-P Discusses Final Fantasy 14 Ending PS4 Support
item.description:
Final Fantasy 14 's time on the PlayStation 4 may come to an end sooner than some fans might like. That detail was provided by Naoki "Yoshi-P" Yoshida himself, who discussed Final Fantasy 14 's future and a number of details regarding upcoming content.

Final Fantasy 14 has largely wrapped up the main story of Dawntrail, its latest expansion, and is moving towards Final Fantasy 14 's next story arc. Fans are waiting with bated breath to see what Final Fantasy 14 will do next, especially with the reception of Dawntrail being mixed. However, gamers who have been playing on the PS4 may not be able to rely on their console to carry them very far into Final Fantasy 14 's future.

Final Fantasy 14 is Pushing PS4 Support to the Limit

In an interview with Feed4Gamers, Yoshi-P was asked about the game's ongoing support of the aging console, pointing to similar games that have dropped the PS4. Yoshi-P side-stepped confirming whether the game would still be playable on the PS4 by the time the game's next expansion or 8.5 patch launches, but explained that the game is reaching the limit on PS4. Yoshi-P states that Sony has hardware regulations "related to the limit of data," and that the developers had previously received an increase in the limit from Sony itself. However, Sony has apparently now informed Square Enix that it's reaching the limit of how far it can push the system.

Yoshi-P confirmed that he and the team want to support as many platforms as they can for as long as possible, but that the hardware will eventually be "at its limits in terms of its technology." When that time comes, PS4 support will come to an end. However, he also added that prior to that happening, he would personally provide clear reasoning and communicate it to the players directly.

Those in the Final Fantasy 14 community who are still playing on PS4 may want to consider upgrading in the near future. The PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PCs are capable of playing the game, and Yoshi-P previously stated that Square Enix has had "positive discussions" about the possibility of bringing Final Fantasy 14 to the Nintendo Switch 2, so that could become an option. The PS4's aging hardware also meant that it didn't receive as many graphical improvements as the PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X versions, so those who upgrade may enjoy seeing the world all over again once they switch to a newer console or PC.
